oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Trinity Lane Church of Christ, 2002 January
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Trinity Lane Church of Christ originally located at 1081 Trinity Lane in Nashville, Tennessee. The address later changed to 1079 Trinity Lane. Currently the Spanish Pentecostal Church of God inhabits the building. The foundation is made of rough cut stone blocks. The exterior walls are red brick. The roof is gabled with tar shingles. The windows are arched with a combination of clear, colored and frosted glass. The doors are metal and glass. Special features include four columns at the front entrance and several pediments. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Trinity Lane Church of Christ (Nashville, Tenn.); Spanish Pentecostal Church of God (Nashville, Tenn.)
